snippet.textDisplay: @yamiryushi I don't know about the gap in voice when your name is stated, but I do know the crappy sound quality of the voices was done deliberately, apparently under the logic that you're an otherworldly spirit and thus you must be hearing people talk in a sort of blurred far away manner. Still a terrible idea anyway.
snippet.textOriginal: @yamiryushi I don't know about the gap in voice when your name is stated, but I do know the crappy sound quality of the voices was done deliberately, apparently under the logic that you're an otherworldly spirit and thus you must be hearing people talk in a sort of blurred far away manner. Still a terrible idea anyway.

snippet.textDisplay: @immortalfrieza That was actually planned? Wow....either they were all really stupid or the people that HAD a brain also had it to not speak out in fear of losing their job. But then again, after that god awful pacman...maze....acid trip........thing....stage....yeah....its not surprising they were a little nuts in the dev department lol
snippet.textOriginal: @immortalfrieza That was actually planned? Wow....either they were all really stupid or the people that HAD a brain also had it to not speak out in fear of losing their job. But then again, after that god awful pacman...maze....acid trip........thing....stage....yeah....its not surprising they were a little nuts in the dev department lol

snippet.textDisplay: @yamiryushi The worst thing? The people who made this game actually thought the whole thing with the voices was a GOOD idea. Whenever somebody puts something in a game, TV show, movie, or whatever that this incredibly obviously idiotic I always question how somebody somewhere along the line doesn't stop and go "this is a REALLY fucking stupid idea" and actually allow it to go through.
snippet.textOriginal: @yamiryushi The worst thing? The people who made this game actually thought the whole thing with the voices was a GOOD idea. Whenever somebody puts something in a game, TV show, movie, or whatever that this incredibly obviously idiotic I always question how somebody somewhere along the line doesn't stop and go "this is a REALLY fucking stupid idea" and actually allow it to go through.

snippet.textDisplay: @immortalfrieza Very true, just say guardian spirit instead of blank spot and put your name on text. Definitely would have made a great difference.
snippet.textOriginal: @immortalfrieza Very true, just say guardian spirit instead of blank spot and put your name on text. Definitely would have made a great difference.

snippet.textDisplay: @yamiryushi They should have just had everybody refer to you as "the guardian spirit" or something like that and inserted the name you chose in the text in the spot where that line should have been.
snippet.textOriginal: @yamiryushi They should have just had everybody refer to you as "the guardian spirit" or something like that and inserted the name you chose in the text in the spot where that line should have been.

snippet.textDisplay: @immortalfrieza What annoyed me is the "right you are *blank for you for a few seconds* blah blah"....I mean, I get that you get to name your character but voice acting in that situation is a bad thing lol
snippet.textOriginal: @immortalfrieza What annoyed me is the "right you are *blank for you for a few seconds* blah blah"....I mean, I get that you get to name your character but voice acting in that situation is a bad thing lol

snippet.textDisplay: @yamiryushi You forgot to mention the terrible voice acting. Well, truth be told the voice acting is good, but the bizarre effect they put over it for no reason is terrible.
snippet.textOriginal: @yamiryushi You forgot to mention the terrible voice acting. Well, truth be told the voice acting is good, but the bizarre effect they put over it for no reason is terrible.

snippet.textDisplay:
Certainly not, especially if you're counting 13 and 12. 
7's cool, but is excessively reputed to the point of being over-appreciated and doesn't need me to speak for it.
8 was underrated, and 10 all around has gotten what it deserves in terms of its general regard.
The glorious implications of their elaborate plots might be too much for you to learn to appreciate, unless you're referring to a different series...
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay:
(part 2) this one has SPOILERS; but some points I want to share


the witches knew about xelha and that's how they managed to tell savyna to go the celestial tree.  Malpercio isn't really a god, but an incarnation of 6 warriors (in an event in origins). the witches doesn't really use magic at all, but either sacred items or magnus extracts. it's stuff like this that really makes the whole plot come together. and very few games actually does that.
snippet.textOriginal:
(part 2) this one has SPOILERS; but some points I want to share


the witches knew about xelha and that's how they managed to tell savyna to go the celestial tree.  Malpercio isn't really a god, but an incarnation of 6 warriors (in an event in origins). the witches doesn't really use magic at all, but either sacred items or magnus extracts. it's stuff like this that really makes the whole plot come together. and very few games actually does that.

snippet.textDisplay:
(part 1) really?...I say the game did a great job in creating distinct and unique environments. Namco went for an exagurated universe where cities are divided by literal skypassages (how often do you see this in a jrpg?) you got the wonderful mira with a city made purely out of treats etc etc, every area is distinct. 
  while the story seemed farfetched and how "fate" was a drive for the plot, everything actually happened in a coherent manner.
snippet.textOriginal:
(part 1) really?...I say the game did a great job in creating distinct and unique environments. Namco went for an exagurated universe where cities are divided by literal skypassages (how often do you see this in a jrpg?) you got the wonderful mira with a city made purely out of treats etc etc, every area is distinct. 
  while the story seemed farfetched and how "fate" was a drive for the plot, everything actually happened in a coherent manner.

snippet.textDisplay: without giving us a clear answer to that, it is vaguely explained that using the wings takes alot of your strenght and makes you weary. it is really apparent after kalas and xelha take on giacomo at the beginning of the game. they have to sit and rest straight after and they are grunting. so using it for small things would be a bad trifle at length. baten kaitos origins pisses on that one though, one can say the wings of the heart might have been stronger back then. just a little speculation lol

Ugh... this game...

erm... how do i say this politely...

They went waaaaay the hell off the fantasy deep end with this one. I cant believe that i forced my self to even complete the story line. After i wound up in a village made of frosting I kinda lost all hope... meh.

Decent tunes though. Oh well, they cant all be all-stars.

snippet.textDisplay: Gamecube had hardly any RPGs, but the few it got were very special.  Skies of Arcadia, Baten Kaitos and Tales of Symphonia were all awesome games, the PS2 had a lot of RPG slurry along with its gems, I must admit.

snippet.textDisplay: I HATED, HATED this game. But the soundtrack (Although way too short and over-used) was easily one of Sakuraba's best. This Mira music was so trippy. Deserved to be in a better game, IMO. (like the countless ones BK ripped off.)
